title: The Laughing Loaf
description: Customers eating morning rolls from Gorm's bakery spend an entire afternoon laughing uncontrollably. Inspector Hewen wants the bakery closed. Alchemist Rynn suspects Mirthbloom spores from an Undercity vent.

turns.narrative: A giggling crowd surrounds the bakery. Inspector Hewen arrives to shut it down. None of the customers appear harmed — they are simply laughing at their own shoes.
turns.choice_a: Defend Gorm and buy time to investigate
turns.consequence_a: Hewen gives you three hours before issuing a closure notice.
turns.choice_b: Side with the Inspector and ask Gorm to close voluntarily
turns.consequence_b: Gorm cooperates. Hewen shares city health records of similar incidents.

turns.narrative: Alchemist Rynn identifies Mirthbloom pollen — airborne spores from purple flowers that only bloom near Undercity vents. Gorm's ovens must be venting through a bloom pocket.
turns.choice_a: Investigate the oven vents below the bakery immediately
turns.consequence_a: In the cellar a crack in the stone leads to a purple Mirthbloom pocket puffing spores with every heat cycle.
turns.choice_b: Ask Rynn to synthesise a neutraliser before going below
turns.consequence_b: Rynn mixes vinegar-ash paste. You don't succumb to laughter when you go below.

turns.narrative: The Mirthbloom pocket can be sealed or harvested — the flowers have genuine alchemical value.
turns.choice_b: Harvest the blooms for Rynn and then seal the crack
turns.consequence_b: You retrieve six full blooms. Rynn pays you generously.

risk_matrix.critical_failure: The attempt failed quietly. The situation remains unresolved.
